column27: >NDPC Risk assessment = off the scale
column29: It is fair to say that this event had its fair share of mechanical hiccups, as fortune would have it we suffered no personal injury to man or beast. This is not including of course the bruising of my bum and my ego as my sulky became a Herby and split in two.
column30: Once again I fail to see the humour in my personal traumatic brush with death at the hooves of the two magnificent pony&rsquo
column31: s whose brute strength alone wrent my sulky asunder. Anybody who tells you it was down to my welding is entirely misguided.
column32: >As for all the usual requirements that go to making up these events. We had the M25 closed north of the river. We had the threat of rain. Yet despite this two of my good friends and travellers made it from oop north across the Woolwich ferry to join us for a few hours of hot dry play. By the mid afternoon I had 5 texts to say people could not make it for one reason or another.
column33: >Given that most of these where cpls. I will leave you to do the maths. What we did end up with was by far the most fun event I think I can personally recall in the history of the club.<span style="""">&nbsp
column34: Billed as THICKSTEAD by one of our regular pony&rsquo
column35: s (yes a pony with whit) it lived up to its name to the tee. We had a jump off as the first event with real proper grown up jumps.<span style="""">&nbsp
column36: One particular stallion will be hobbled or shot if he drags me round the course like a butcher&rsquo
column37: s dog stealing sausages again.<span style="""">&nbsp
column38: A job for Sir Ian and his gun I feel?
column39: The jousting went off as usual with great hilarity and minimal cheating.
column40: This could not be said however for trainer and pony that chose to cut a swathe through the tea party under a shady tree thus adding a good few seconds ONTO there time. Yet still coming in first on the second run. Practice huh?
column41: >It is my duty to impart details of yet another mechanical breakdown of epic proportions. This time not in the paddock where assistance and repair could be made available post haste.<span style="""">&nbsp
column42: No this misshape occurred on the dense woodland path. Making helicopter access impossible. We are to far from any navigable river to make a nautical rescue viable. So the only alternative short of bringing in the marines. Was to carry SIR IAN&rsquo
column43: s broken sulky out by hand.<span style="""">&nbsp
column44: God it was hell. I would have helped but my bum hurt.
column45: >All in all as far as I could see and tell. The 18 revellers that survived the Motorway system had a fantastic time. Old faces welcomed new and made firm friends on a whinny and a handshake.<span style="""">&nbsp
column46: I know the NDPC will go from strength to strength if we keep up this level of enthusiasm and pride in what we offer.
column47: >Oh yes and there was a useless muddy flee ridden poodle there as well. It&rsquo
column48: s fair to say she is very very beautiful but couldn&rsquo
column49: t catch a rabbit if she had a walk on part in watership down.
column52: >So once again. We at the NDPC thank you all for coming. And to remind everybody. This would not happen where it not for Andy and his girls
column53: >Take care all and see you soon
column54: >Trainer Bryan and the NDPC crew

column3: >North Downs
column13: >And not before time I hear you all think? <span style="""">&nbsp
column14: Well by way of an explanation for my editorial tardiness, I can only say, &ldquo
column23: s get the shameless plugs out of the way first.<span style="""">&nbsp
column24: For those of you fortunate enough to have the required televisual wizardry at your fingertips.
column25: The NDPC has now been given air time by two major TV channels and is appearing regularly apparently. So keep an eye out for Kinky and Proud from Virgin. Plus one we did a year or so a go with Sir Guy from French Canal 5 with that chap Antoine De Cur.
column26: Also we have a lovely editorial in this months Scarlet magazine featuring my infinitely squeezable Farabela, &ldquo
column32: >The outdoor events of the year concluded with a wonderful sunny day at the DV8 club. Official grounds NDPC. <span style="""">&nbsp
column33: We where blessed with a more than average turnout for the time of year. Once again we decided on a relaxed format for the day. Given the mixture of attendees, for the first time ever and with some pride I can say we had exactly the right amount of beautiful DOM ladies to attend to the very happy and grateful pony boys.
column34: With all the ponies (both male and female) taken care of, I found myself at something of a loss. This sense of being unloved was quickly replaced with a sore ear hole. I had decided to tack up my adorable little Farabela pony Carousel. In her shiny new red and white livery she quite literally stole the show. She has always been a very norty pony. And has recently become a bloody noisy one too.
column35: At barely 15 hands she can whinny and snort like a
column37: > cotton mill claxon. Having run me ragged round the paddock and woods and destroyed 50% of my hearing I took her to her stall, watered her, fed her and rubbed her down for the day. Once again I found myself ambling around with a sense of awe at how well it was all going. So I made use of a very amenable subs bum.<span style="""">&nbsp
column38: I found the aforementioned sub dangling between a cpl of trees in the woods.
column39: Its amazing what you find in them there woods. Suffice it to say that said subby went home with a very sore bum and legs.
column40: All in all a wonderful day was had by all. And as one we all agreed that the spring could not come soon enough. Once again our thanks go out to the big guy Andy and his two lovely girls that make these events doable and so much fun.
column54: I was looking forward to this year with a feeling of excitement and trepidation all at once.
column56: s something about this night that stands out above all the others in my mind. The fact that it is ostensibly a charitable event, I believe is a moral reminder to us all that even in these economically challenging times,<span style="""">&nbsp
column57: we can and should all give a little of ourselves to those less fortunate. Ok that&rsquo
column58: s the speech out the way lol.
column60: >So yes, two days before the show I had 5 beautiful girls ready to don the hooves and tails and trot out for the night.<span style="""">&nbsp
column61: One night before I have 2. On the night I have none.
column62: Rapid dial mode and a cpl of antiperspirant busting armpits later and my two buddies come out for me.
column63: The upshot of the evening was that we had the best ever time. Pony girl Lisitu was to be found with her bits out in public for the first time since child birth. (It took two strong men to get her dressed to go home I might add grrrrrr) Her partner and pony boy Galahad was a great favourite with the Ladies.
column64: What is it about little girls and a big shiny sweaty stallion?
column67: >Once again I found myself able to enjoy the night whilst my two frolicking charges made a complete spectacle of themselves with no help from me whatsoever.<span style="""">&nbsp
column68: What did amuse me however was the amount of people that approached me with the words &ldquo
column72: >Short fat bloke in a Bowler hat, red jacket and jodhpurs with two pony&rsquo
column73: s on reigns? Duhhhhhhhhhh. Roll on next year Tuppy. You rock
column79: s it for w while
column81: >Once again. Thank you to Andy and the crew at DV8
column83: >From Trainer Bryan and all at the stable.

column1: event,"On a lighter note . My little Terry the Tumor has taken to keeping me awake at nights lately with odd and rather annoying headaches.
What the silly little thing doesn't seem to realize is that i have been doing this for nearly 40 years with the assistance of good English Bitter and even better Irish Whisky.
So fuck ya Terry . your not so clever after all are ya?"

event,"There are things in a life that make ya sit up and take a look around for the shrouded figure that is fate. A cpl of years ago i bout my vintage Suzuki off a dear old friend of mine . He loved that bike and didn't want to part with it . But it needed a lot of TLC&nbsp
column2: I had the time and the passion, he didn't&nbsp
column3: So coinage of&nbsp
column4: the realm changed hands and the deed was done.

column1: On Friday i decided to take the old girl off the road for a while for much needed work . So the SORN was applied for.&nbsp
column2: ""The Tank"" as a girly friend of mine rather ungraciously but aptly named it , is now off the road.

column1: On Sunday i receive call from another friend to say that My old Biking mate had committed suicide on Friday. The tank sits in my garden, it is one of the saddest things i think i have seen in a very long time.&nbsp
column2: Ironicly its Black . and when the pitiful English sun catches its paintwork., it conveys the pointlessness of the deed and the passing of a beautiful and waisted life. You will be missed by all that knew you mate .

column1: I doubt i will ever ride the tank again?"
event,"Well absolutely no bloody news so far on the lump in my gray matter . Other than that it is a Glioma ?

yeah . thats what i thought. Now having said that . I have not slept for three days on the trot . It may well be phsyco sematic (and i guess thats not how you spell it but sod it) Anyway . w all get headaches and do''nt realy think much about it .
So why am i getting these low dull achy head aches deep down right where Da lump is innit ? So much so that i just cant nod off cos i am scared i wont wake up ?&nbsp
column2: and that is odd cos i had a guest with me&nbsp
column3: the other night and she&nbsp
column4: thought i was dead bless her ROFLMAO. Not that any body gives a toss . But i will add to this little journo as the tale of Da lump init ,&nbsp

column1: event,"I have a Tumor . I am going to call him Terry. You have to laugh realy . Aparently his second name is Glioma?&nbsp
column2: The ministry of they,&nbsp
column3: have decided that Terry might or might not have been around for some time. He may be binign . he may not . Given the inconclusive nature of this diagnosis they have decided to run a test. In 6 months. Not tomorrow . Not next week . But 6 months. Reason? Well its obvious really isn't it? To see if Terry is&nbsp
column5: Now forgive me . But are we not being told continuosly that cancers and so on can be treated far easier and with greater success if they are caught in the early stages? I have this mental image of all the chaps at the ministry&nbsp
column6: of they running a sweep stake to see who can grow the biggest Terry or equivelent in a given amount of time. The winner recieves the coveted platinum Petri dish.&nbsp
column7: Well whist the chaps at the ministry of They wait patiently for the myriad Terries and there cousins to propagate in bits of anatomies all over the country, I hope they don't mind If i ponder on the reasoning behind there delaying tactics . I dare say Terry will grow . And i dare say it's vital that they find out how much by in the ensuing months. But none of this takes away the gut churning fear every time i get a twinge of a headache like the one i have now.&nbsp
column8: Still , Terry is nice and snug and warm up there in my head. Shame my bloody feet are freezing . Must put some sox on.

column2: The Night of the Senses

column1: Well once again the North Downs Pony Club went forth into the seemingly unknown. By kind invite to the Night of the senses, myself and two beautiful ponies. My own Ardis and a new girl i am training Varmi and her groom arrived in Brixton just outside the venue itself . The well known Mass. For those that don't now it. Its a huge church in the middle of a huger island surrounded by Huger amounts of traffic. Oh joy. Chaos ensued as soon as we entered the place . Stewards everywhere clearly drafted in for the night as none of them had a clue where we where supposed to be lol.&nbsp
column2: So in true pioneering spirit. I let my Ardis deal with it while i went perving. (hey its my job) We watched some of the earlier breathtaking stage shows and began to realise we had a lot to live up to at this point. After locating the backstage dressing rooms i did my best to get the two girls changed. I am beginning to realise that Ardis is not an ordinary Pony. No . she is a Barbi Pony. As i am un packing her harness and tac . she is revealing pots of Vaseline and lots of little tubes of glitter. Varmi is befouling the air with nervous dyspepsia (clearly not used to the roar of the grease paint and the smell of the crowd yet lol) The girls are now ready . I am covered in bloody glitter ""thanks Ardis grrrrrrrr"" We climb three flights of stairs to the rear of the stage to find it completely submerged in soapy water? The show is clearly not going to happen due to us not being able to stand up. Apparently the previouse act was ummmm shall we say , based on a young ladies hydraulics ?

column1: The front row where soaked as well hmmmmmm?

A brief Pony Trainer type conference and we decided to simply stampede the club, and so we did. The pony's and I toured all three floors , up and down lifts (yes ponies in lifts lol)In and out of rooms drawing gasps of awe and amazement , ""dam the girls looked beautiful"". It was decided to simply let them loose and enjoy themselves , and this they did with aplomb.&nbsp
column2: Ever seen two ponies fighting over a love heart sweety ? too funny. Varmi thought it amusing to wait till i got in the lift then charge me into a crumpled heap in the corner, Pony head space?

column1: It is always satisfying to watch the credits of an epic movie and read the part where it says "" no animals where injured during the making of this movie ""

Sadly this was not the case. We did not make a movie for a start. No, poor Varmi. On her first ever trip out in her new boots Took a tumble. Steel shoes on stone floors . Bad combo. Sadly she has sprained a fetlock quite badly and will be out of the paddock for a few weeks. In true Pony spirit though she has asked me to make her some new Boots with suckers on lol.
All in all a great night.
Tears , laughter, drama, pathos. it had it all.
Huge thanx to Tuppy Owens for the chance to let the NDPC&nbsp
column2: strut its stuff. And of course to all the crew there that made us so welcome. We will be back if we are invited

column1: event,"For the benifit of all those worry warts out there that found my previous photo's offensive.&nbsp
column2: By way of proving that i do have cooth.&nbsp
column3: Heres one of me and my beautiful Ardis posing for the camera at the Kent Fetish Fayer a while ago.&nbsp
column4: And befor the eagle eyed among you go balistic yet again. I know i am not wearing a tie. I didnt wear one for either of my weddings. I don't wear one in court . So i fail to see why I should wear one as a Trainer.&nbsp
column5: However, i feel safe in the knowledge that one of you will have a pop about it anyway.&nbsp
column6: Told you all I was bloody gorgious though did'nt I?&nbsp
column8: Do you like the hat, rather me is'nt it ?

column1: Take care you guys. And for gods sake lighten up.

event,"Some of you may have noticed the occasional reference to the commings and goings of the roadworks at the end of my road. Lets not go there huh ? suffice it to say that they have rendered our little village almost entirely cut of from the civilised world.&nbsp
Imagine then if you will the sight that met me when i managed to actualy get out onto the main road this morning with no hastle (no bloody lights . no roadworks !!!!!!!!!)

column2: I had traved no more that 200 yards when the trafic in front of me had come to a total standstill for as far as the eye could see . (more roadworks.lights thinks I)

column1: Now as i happened to be on my motorbike at the time i did the thing that pisses the four wheeled motorist off more than anything lol . Yep . I zipped down the outside, tee hee . After about half a mile of nipping in and out of the traffic i was in a fairly chirpy mood . When there it was. Surealism incarnate.
Now i need you to understand that despite this being a major arterial road , at this point it is very narrow . (about 8 or 9 miles of one lane traffic each way.&nbsp
column2: Sat stood still in the road ahead . was THOMAS THE TANK ENGINE.&nbsp
column3: no i am not on drugs . and yes i am of sound mind and body.&nbsp
column4: 70 tons of shunter sitting on a bloody great low loader in the road. the low loader had died and the driver was sitting there reading his paper waiting for the little man to pull him away , DUHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH.&nbsp
column5: About 20 miles or so from here is a wonderfull piece of local history . Its the bluebelle railway . they have lots of beutifuly restored steam loco's and so on . and are constantly opening new stretches of dissused railway (thanx for that Mr beaching) . Naturaly amongst their prize excibits is good ole THOMAS . Every now and then he goes on a little outing to another railway and puffs up and down with hoards of happy smiling Marmite flavoured children on board his creaky old carriages . But not today . today he was stuck half a mile from my house looking very silly indeed.&nbsp
column6: So I want to take my hat off&nbsp
column8: overwieght . and I like to be in control ok grrrrrrrr) to the reverand W V Audry for his inspred creation. To see it leap from the pages of his wonderful books in such grand style was truly up lifting roflmao."

column1: event,"Well summer in england wrought its usual havock a the length and breath of the country . I wonder at the tenacity and fortitude of the massive army of little parish councilors . church do gooders and school teacheres that tirelesly devote there time and effort every year to bring a ray of sunshine to there local comunity , and possibly raise a few quid for a local charity of some sort .&nbsp
column2:
And with out fail . It pisses down ever bloody year .

My story ?
column3: Well myself and a few stalwart comunity minded souls have been organising a fayre within a local comunity. ( www.dv8.uk.com ) How public spirited i hear you think.
column4:
Well its fair to say that the comunity in question is actualky the local fetish scene , but hey . its a fayre right ?

My part in all this ? Well i run a Human pony play group . so the ail was to have a few pony boys and girls there . Well as per the usual things never actualy pan out as one expects . But we are Brittish so we gird our loins and carry on regardless. Having spent weeks making a shiney new cart for my beautifu lPony Ardis to pull me along in
column5:
it turns out on the day that we are waterlogged . so that stayed at home . A week befor the event my #1 Pony girl and admin officer ceases to exsist ( no i didnt shoot her although the thought did cross my mind lol) and so it goes on .

The event itself went swimmingly despite the attempts of mother nature . The car park burst to overflowing . The main arena was a murmuring burbling riot of activity with lots of loverly demos and superb stalls to buy thing or just ohh and ahhhhhhhh over.
column7: As for our contribution? Well Ardis My beloved and beautiful Pony girl ( pis to follow) Rapidly became the centre of attention , with awe struck gazes following her in her wake where ever she gracefully wandered.&nbsp
column8: Granted not many ponies on full dressage /show rig are seen sipping vodka and coke elegantly for a bloody straw.&nbsp
column10:
and one cannot live on chopped bananas alone right ?

So there you have it . A great day was had buy all those you braved the surrounding motorways and the ensuing summer madness.therein. We had a little natter at one point and decided that this was definately to be the first of many events along the same lines .
So who knows . Maybe you will share a day with us in the near future .

In the mean time . take care and play safe all of you
Trainer Bryan &

column1:
event,"Well i guess as we all go through life we lose things one way or another. From simply misplacing an item to being robbed.

Like most of us i have been robbed burgled or whatever at some point or another. However i have just experienced a new and interesting form of theft.
column2: Ive had a dream stolen&nbsp
column3: right from under my nose.&nbsp
column5: Now with a car . a stereo , a wallet or&nbsp
column6: indeed most material items, They are replacable in one form or another.&nbsp
column9: Answere me this . You ever tried to replace a dream?
column10: A tangible touchable, warm, living dream.&nbsp
column11: Hell i have ideas aplenty. and a cpl of very cosy little thoughts about me. (one stayed over this weekend ""thanx Ardis"") But my dream has been cruely and cold heartedly snatched away from me. Oh well , shit happens i guess.

column1: event,"Isnt it funny how one day can be completely different from another?&nbsp
column2: Just as well realy i guess, life would be awfully dull otherwise.&nbsp
column3: Yesterday i was all ready to blather on about a theory i have been stewing on for weeks now , and today my hearts just not in it for one reason or another.&nbsp
column4: Interestingly enough i am consumed with another emotion. The complete negative of love in fact.&nbsp
column5: Yep , HATE. I know what your gonna say . "" the&nbsp
column6: emotion and the energy it involves are a total waist of time""&nbsp
column7: Anoyingly i totaly agree. However it transpires that somebody has gone out of there way to ruin my otherwise fairly mundane life with there pettyness and self centred theological bullshit.&nbsp
column8: The theologicly challenged tend to have a particularly narrow outlook on life and none more so than in the case of this individual.

column1: So back to the Love issue. (not that i can be assed now but here goes anyway) I find i am surrounded by poeple that i can genuinly say i love. There are many others that i care for,&nbsp
column2: In general i am a decent guy that will help where ever i can and be there for those that matter to me.&nbsp
column3: The idea of loving someone sends waves of confusion though some people and often trepidation and fear.&nbsp
column4: Its as if by saying "" i love you"" that you are commiting them to a lifetimes contractual agreement to be bound to reciprocate. Nothing could be further from the truth in most cases.&nbsp
column5: I adore and love most of my friends (given that the word freind is a very missused word indeed)&nbsp
column6: My true freinds know who they are and know i love them.&nbsp
column7: Funny what ya come out with after 8 pints and a curry lol?&nbsp
column8: I know one or two of them feel a reciprocal love or emotion very similar. We have cried together at funerals, weddings, rugby matches and so on.&nbsp
column9: Regards family . well yes i guess its fair to say that most of us love our kith and kin to a cirtain degree wether we like to admit it or not .&nbsp
column10: Personaly i cant stand to be in the same room as my father . But i love him because he is my father.&nbsp
column11: In his own way he made me what i am today . Every thing he's not ""thank god lol""&nbsp
column12: I have recently taken on the temporary care of a big hairy dog.&nbsp
column13: Once again i can genuinly say that i am growing to love her despite the drawbacks of actualy owning a dog and the affect it is having on my everyday life. But she has brought something into our home (apart from hair and duck shit) and that is unconditional love, centred mostly round her belly its true . but its there.&nbsp
column14: Now . heres the bit that sends the ripples of confusion through the masses.&nbsp
column16: I am not in love with my freinds, my children my family, or the dog (mind you she has killer eyes XXX) After a great deal of consideration i have realised that i have only been in love three times in my life.&nbsp
column18: unrequited to all intents and purposes.&nbsp
column19: Its fair to say they they&nbsp
column20: had a profound affect on me in seperate ways and changed me as a person imesurably.&nbsp
column21: One was quite simply a juvenile infatuation. Yet over the years i have looked back on it and realised that it was indeed my first and probably only genuine love. Ironicly it was rekindled somewhat disasterously several years later.&nbsp
column22: (we met at a rugby match after many&nbsp
column23: years). The second was my first wife.&nbsp
column24: No analysis neccesary . I was completely infatuated and head over heels in love . That episode took me&nbsp
column25: 15 years to get over. The third ?&nbsp
column26: My beautiful and long time submissive, soul mate, and best friend. She is always in my heart.&nbsp
column28: Interestingly enough , i have always been polygamouse and never gave a thought to a multy partner relationship being an issue untill recently.&nbsp
column29: During all of my relationship i have always been open about my feelings and so on. As i say . up untill recently its never been an issue.&nbsp
column30: Maybe there are poeple out there who are more afraid of being offered someones love on an unconditional basis than i ever imagined. Its a gift . Its not shrouded in self doubt,&nbsp
column32: or any other underlying emotional adhesive.&nbsp
column33: If its offered . accept it, embrace it,&nbsp
column34: take it for what it is.&nbsp
column35: Just please avoid the duck shit  .

column1: Well that wasnt how i had planned it in my head lol . But its all ya gonna get for today.

column2: Byeeeeeeee

column1: event,"I could wax lyrcal for pages on the subject. I wont however. Far more erudite and literate souls have been here before me.&nbsp
column2: The point of this particular missive is thus. There seems to be some confusion as to the definition of&nbsp
column3: <i>loving.&amp
column4: being in love. i cant find how to save this to draft and somw folks have just turned up so i will be back later to finnish this little theory of mine . byeeeee"

column1: event,"Greetings my fun filled fellow forum filers&nbsp

Yesterday was my Birthday. Now i never expect much of a rush on the pressie front given that its always on a bank holiday and the postman doesnt work then. So imagine how unsurprised i was to find sod all in the way of gifts . cards or even Woolworth vouchers being hand delivered by friends and family. Thank god for that .&nbsp
Look at the money ive saved in return gestures lol?&nbsp
Many years ago i began to realise that most poeple have a flair if you like for&nbsp
column2: different things,&nbsp
column3: &nbsp
column5: Conversly most of us are pretty shite at other things.&nbsp
column6: Now given that i am a self confessed borderline genius, it behoves me to impart that my archilies heel as it where is "" PAINTING""&nbsp
column7: Now if you could actualy lay the bloody wall or cieling that you wanted painting actualy on the floor and didnt mind the occasiona lumpy bit or run here and there . THEN&nbsp
column8: stand the whole thing back up again when it was dry.&nbsp
column9: The chances are i'de still fuck it up lol. So in light of this . i spent my birthday painting my bathroom in lumpy paint.

column1: Oh yeah and the other thing. My beautifull and beloved Pony has new hooves.&nbsp
column2: She will look impossibly gorgiouse in them and leave lovely little hoofy prints in my lawn grrrrrrr.&nbsp
column3: &nbsp
column4: Ironicly i used to hate hoof prints when i was mountain biking in my every waking moment.&nbsp
column5: Now i miss them with a passion. Ok . bathroom painted (badly)&nbsp
column7: Now i must go make some more floggers.&nbsp
column9: Poeple keep buying em off me.&nbsp
column11: Yeah i know its my job but it would be nice to actualy go to a club, open my box and not get savaged by money weilding wantlings ""bless em lol"" Oh dam i can be an egotistical git sometimes.&nbsp

column1:
event,"

Well its been a funny few days hence my not getting on here at all in a while.
column2: Ive been plagued by a sence of being out of control. Not a feeling i am acustomed to.&nbsp
column3: This is not an egotistic outburst, far from it , bringing up two children on my own and a career in management has embeded this in me by nature.&nbsp
column5: So this feeling of floundering around at a loose end has got to be addressed . to a degree i have nailed it down and got to the bottom of why it all started. Now i have to dig myself out the other side.&nbsp
column6:
We all have to confront demons and self doubt now and then in our lives . and most of us pull it off . I'm bathed in sunlight at the end of the tunnel as write this so its looking good. Just a cpl of things to sort out with a close friend . and bridges to rebuild with another and then were there. Ready for the next sack of crap life chooses to dump on me lol (ever the optimist tee hee )

"

column1:
event,"

Oky doky . Yet another day from Planet Bryan. Fear not I am not goping to drag your eyes through yet another load of misery and woe.
column2: But I will say this (didnt think you'd get away scott free did ya lol?)&nbsp
column3: I have never been gifted as a phtographer . I have no problems whith this ok ? I accept my failings with grace ( and a few conciliatary pints when possible) However . When i tell someone that i am goiung to do something i go out of my way to make good that proclamation. So yes . I will post some pics . As soon as someone turns up that can take pictures . Cos the little camera&nbsp
column4: I bought the other day doesnt like me very much at all grrrrrrrrrr.&nbsp
column6: and if anybody reading this owns a battery company that would be realy realy handy too.&nbsp
column7: I am off to see one of my subbies tonight
column8: and a new friend in the making . a realy cute TG who is looking to be trained as a pony Wonders where this is gonna lead ??? will keep ya informed on that one . As for subby girl ? Well&nbsp
column9: unless my head space gets more chilled&nbsp
column10: I cant see us playing much.&nbsp
column11: I never play if the heads in pissed off or&nbsp
column13: It just opens the door to bad khama and potential bad play. Classic example the other week when i took my snake to my subby with a freind watching. We all wanted it .&nbsp
column14:
But we'd had a realy wierd weekend. No damage done but definately not a good scene. Conclusion ?
Huge slap on the wrist for me for being stupid enough to go there with potentialy dangerous toy. Big cuddles and apologies to subby later on for being a twat. After all she was only doing as she was told , plus she loves the snake anyway. And nope i am not gonna put any blame on her for saying yes cos shes still new and i should have known better. Fortunatly my dear freind that was with us was also aware of the whole mind set and we talked about it after at length so thats all sorted. So yes .
column15: I have been in the scene a very long time. Know I dont know everything.&nbsp
column17: Yes we all do dumb things now and then.&nbsp
column18: Trick is not to do them to often and dont hurt anybody in the process.&nbsp

column1: event,"Well today started well, took a bit of a nosedive, got better again , then went totaly tits up . and now ? well now i am chuffed to bits.&nbsp
We started off going to the sea side as it was clear i wasnt going to get any work done with the boys at my heels.&nbsp
column2: Imediately the lights at the end of my road conspired against me. This combined with Vincent forgetting his bloody fone again set my mind in Donkey mode. So off we went home. Although (and this is the exciting bit) we didnt actualy go home . NO . for reasons beyond my ken i decided to visit a DIY store on a Sunday , WHYYYYYYYYYYYYYYY???????????.&nbsp
column3: In the car park of the affor mentioned store a large vehicle driven by a very very large man and his diminutive but noisy wife decided to trash the back of my car.&nbsp

column1: As the genetic throwback of a man got out of the car i suspected this could get a tad nasty so i ushered the boys to one side. I was somewhat stunned when the 6'4"" muscle bound slopehead sort of cowered and looked at me while his 5' sod all wife went into one. Its now maybe 8 hours after the incident and i am wondering if shes paused to drawn breath lol. No wonder the big fella has lost the will to fight bless him.
Anyway.. Then we went to see my mum.&nbsp
column2: Or my sweet potato as i like to call her . cos shes almost a vegetable and there the only veg i realy love.&nbsp
column3: Then we did some shopping and gave the bird to all the sunday drivers being pulled over for speeding (jees i am such a cheerfull bastard.&nbsp

column1: Now for the realy realy exciting bit . When we got home i decided to make a little something for a friend of mine. Now this isnt a biggie granted . after all thats what i do . make toys right ?&nbsp

column2: include a braid that has been eluding me for ever . I even went to a nieghbour and asked her if she could suss it out with the drawings i had downloaded . After an hour she gave up and said it couldnt be done. Guess what ? I did it , yeeeeeeeeee haaaaaaaaa&nbsp

column1: The result is a seriously nasty but rather pretty twin tail cat in rawhide. Its got a nifty swivel and the whole thing is finnished with a cherry wood handle. Now of course i am wrestling with my conciense. (Not a problem as i cant even spell it lol) Does my chumly get it or not ?
Why have boring days when you can be meeeeeee&nbsp
event,"Well last night was a total bloody dissaster on the writing front . i have decided not to click any buttons untill my journal tutor returns to the fold.&nbsp
column2: Anyway i didnt get to sleep till about 2am this morning tossing and turning , fretting and worrying . I do that and its so&nbsp
column3: annoying . I wish i could turn myself off sometimes and just sleep . After all its one of the things i do remarkably well. A great deal of my ankst is caused by my SAD. For those of you not in the know . this is a thing called ""seasonaly affected dissorder"" Its a form of depression caused by the changes in &nbsp
column4:
barometric pressure and so on. Usualy when its grey we sufferers are crawling around on our hands and knees . when its sunny ? well every buggers happy. Except lypoma sufferers i guess? Well as you can see , the suns out this morning and i am reletaively chirpy lol.

OK . lets go back over last nights efforts. What i was enedevouring to impart was that i have been busily making more toys for a show at the end of June. 30th to be precise, at the DV8 liesure club in Kent http://www.dv8.uk.com
column5: I am also taking my two pony girls out for there first public show, So i am realy realy excited. The day will also be the first ever effort staged by the ndponyclub http://www.ndponycub.co.uk. So naturaly i am a lttle nervouse as well.
column6: Lots of work to do and to be honest its all a little daunting, but fun.
column7: Well yesterday i amused myself making a cpl of nautical toys based on traditional Brittish Navy CP.&nbsp
column8: Damm you gotta love the navy lol. The first one is a piece i have made befor and sold with great success . its real name is a Gunners Starter , so called as it would be made by the offending Gunner from the block ropes used to haul the guns about on decks. The idea being that the poor bugger would have to make the intrement of his own&nbsp
column9: punnishment ( cool huh?) The second little gizmo its once again a traditiona twin tail cat. In my mind far to much emphasis has been given to the 9 tail cat . whilst this was effective it was seldome used on board ship for two reasons.&nbsp
column10: If its made from rope its next best thing to useless unless its weighted on the tips, &nbsp
column11:
if this is the case the Matlo (seaman)was usualy to badly wounded to be of any use there after the punnishment . Pluss leather on board was a preciouse comodity so it was unlikely to be used for such menial persuits. Now given that the average sail rigged 3 master would carry about 12 mile of rope , what do you think they used ???
the twin tail was a much more effective . easy to make and all round jollier way or stripping the skin from Jack Tars back .
column13: I will pop up a pic of the Gunners Starter. I like to call em the Boatswains Bitch, But then i'm just a perve tee hee.
column15: Oh yeah and last night i found some decent tickets for a trip we are planning . and yep . the other half of the WE was asleep a cpl of hundred miles away with her bloody diary so i called her at an indecent hour this morning just to tell her, arent i wonderfull lol?
column16: Just a footnote to a little individual who means the world to me and to whome i have spent far to much time being an asshole and saying sorry to.
column18: See how optimistic i am being? XXX"

column1: event,"right . heres the deal . as i said . i am not a great writer and dont find putting my feelings and emotions into the written word very easy . so when i am sitting here at 1 o clock in the morning and decide to pour my heart out on here . cos it seemed like a good way of letting off steam and so on .&nbsp
it realy realy pisses me off when the fuckin thing loses the whole lot .&nbsp
so i will walk away now and revue the point of this whole thing&nbsp
to think i actualy did feel better for a very very short while.&nbsp
column2: No realy i did . but that just seems to be the way my blody life is goin at the moment&nbsp

column1: by the way hun . there was a lot in there about you too . and optimism and all that .&nbsp
Dont say i aint trying cos i am. i realy realy am"

event,"

Well hello everybody. (assumes an audience with the masses lol) It has been sudgested to me by a close friend that i start writing a journal.
column2: I felt compelled to say that in the event that you dont see her alive again you will know that it was a bad idea and she has incured my wrath.&nbsp
column3: This statement alone has told you that very&nbsp
column4: few of my personal cock ups are&nbsp
column6: Now we all know that in reality this is seldome true . we are all falible . Some of us are even human albeit that documentary evidence is often hard to come by.&nbsp
column7: Take me for instance (no realy . somebody please take me) Born in london in the year they ended rationing after the war.&nbsp
column8: I atribute my waif like frame to the deprivations incured during the eary years.&nbsp
column9: Been married twice, Well with respect, sometimes one course of aversion therapy doesnt always do the trick right ?&nbsp
column10:
I am now blessed with two boys to whome i am the sole carer and parent . Vincent 14 years of age and a lifestyle Goth ( dam good with a flogger and single tail for his age i might add) and of course Joe nearly 10 (shit its his birthday soon grrrrrrr) More about my boys as time goes on ok . Suffice it to say that my lifestyle as a full on bendier than a bent thing from benstville perve cannot and never will compremise my role as a single dad to my boys. So how do i get round that i here you think ?
Simple. Ya just give em all the luv en stuff ya can . Oh yeah , and you bring em up in the lifestyle.
column11: I have many freinds who have raised kids in the scene and they have turned out to be the most well adjusted , stable and loved kids you ever could meet.&nbsp
column13: Moving away from the boys for a sec .
column14: i just looked down the page and noticed a box with&nbsp
column16: . This is my first time remember. Hell . what sort of a mood am i in now ?&nbsp
column17: Well i'le give you a clue,&nbsp
column18: this morning i woke with the feeling that my heart had been ripped out (long story) I am an emotional dweeb ok lol.&nbsp
column19: With my usual gift for sharing my misery . i called the person who got me into this journal gig in the first place and proceeded to bugger her day up and nearly ruin our relationship once and for all .(yes i'm a prick ok duhhhhhhhhh) THENNNNNNNNNNN i get a call from&nbsp
column20: that brought the sunshine back into my life again so i called said freind and went into groveling mode (and i'm supposed to be a DOM? lol). I am seriously considering throwing my mobile away . it will save everybody a lot of grief .Next thing i know i am called upon to drive into the wilderness on my old 750 to give a&nbsp
column21: girl some lessons on how to drive her motorbike (yes i used to be an instructor).&nbsp
column22: Shes getting there but bloody slowly . definately not a natural. and then back to the boys . we went shopping for some bits and bobs for the dungeon and my little treasure Vincent forgets his sodding pin number and gets his ATM card cancelled . He has mild ADD and makes my life ? well interesting to say the least lol. So . My mood ? well i just read through the&nbsp
column23: options and none of em cover my present state of mind.&nbsp
column24: So i will go for . In love . lonely . frustrated . realy realy happy . and full of beans . with maybe a hint of yearning thrown in.&nbsp
column25: Oh yeah . and when she gets to read this . just to piss her off . I miss you.&nbsp
column26: So there ya go . my first journal.
column27: If you started reading this and where depressed befor you&nbsp
column28: started . i dare say your suicidal by now lol well tough . wait till i realy get going. tee hee. Byeeeeeeeeeeee&nbsp
column29: and all of you . please take care and play safe ok
